intro: Tamonea androsaemifolia, commonly known as the Andros Island beauty, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean island of Andros. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in wet, coastal areas and thrives in humid, tropical climates. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
